title: Correct Beach
description:
Baltic beaches often allow you to find pieces of amber gleaming in the sun or hidden in the sand.
You can spot amber on the Baltic beaches every day. But it can be usually found after autumn and winter storms. The waves wash it out from the seabed and the sea currents carry it to the beaches along with the flotsam.
Amber fishers often say: It is not we who find amber, it finds us!
To fish pieces of amber out of the sea, amber fishers use special scoop nets attached to long poles.

children.value:
Baltic beaches often allow you to find pieces of amber gleaming in the sun or hidden in the sand.
You can spot amber on the Baltic beaches every day. But it can be usually found after autumn and winter storms. The waves wash it out from the seabed and the sea currents carry it to the beaches along with the flotsam.
Amber fishers often say: It is not we who find amber, it finds us!
To fish pieces of amber out of the sea, amber fishers use special scoop nets attached to long poles.

The search for amber usually takes a long time, often at night. To protect themselves from the water and cold, fishers wear warm and waterproof clothing. In the past, it used to be made of sealskin; today, it is made of modern fabrics.
